page.title: 06THE CANAL NEAR OUR SCHOOL
page.content: The bridge just outside{Little Heath {Primary School}is bridge no 7 on the {Coventry Canal.}We know it as Old Church Road Bridge. On the earliest maps it was known as Little Heath Bridge. It was then a traditional hump backed bridge. Just through the bridge on the towpath side is the Royal Hotel Public House. Stuart, John and I went to the{canal repair crew.}People had complained that water from the{canal had been coming into their gardens so a repair service from{British {Waterways}came. They started on Monday 20th May. They used dredgers to plug the leak with clay.Children from our middle school went on the{Coventry {Canal}in a barge for their school trip this month. {Stuart Brown age 11 {John Deacan age 11 {Harjinder Samra age 10
